content.description: The manager of a symphony in a large city wants to investigate music preferences for adults and students in the city. Let <math alttext="p sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the population proportion of adults who live in the city who prefer pop music. Let <math alttext="p sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the population proportion of students who live in the city who prefer pop music. Random samples of 200 adults from the city and 200 students from the city will be selected.
content.question: Which of the following is the best interpretation of <math alttext="the probability of, open parenthesis, p hat sub A, end sub, minus p hat sub S, end sub, is greater than 0, close parenthesis, is approximately equal to 0.022" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>≈</mo><mn>0.022</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The difference between the population proportion of adults who prefer pop music and the population proportion of students who prefer pop music is approximately 0.022.
The difference between the population proportion of adults who prefer pop music and the population proportion of students who prefer pop music is 0.

For all random samples of 200 adults from the city and 200 students from the city, the difference between the sample proportion of adults who prefer pop music and the sample proportion of students who prefer pop music will be 0.022.

For all random samples of 200 adults from the city and 200 students from the city, the difference between the sample proportion of adults who prefer pop music and the sample proportion of students who prefer pop music will be 0.

For all random samples of 200 adults from the city and 200 students from the city, the sample proportion of adults who prefer pop music will be greater than the sample proportion of students who prefer pop music in about 2.2% of samples.

content.answer: For all random samples of 200 adults from the city and 200 students from the city, the sample proportion of adults who prefer pop music will be greater than the sample proportion of students who prefer pop music in about 2.2% of samples.

topic.text: 5.6: Sampling Distributions for Differences in Sample Proportions

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
